name: DistalSymmetricPolyneuropathyDSPICD10CM
title: Distal Symmetric Polyneuropathy (DSP) (ICD10CM)
description: The value set contains ICD10CM billing codes for distal symmetric polyneuropathy (DSP). DSP is defined here as neuropathies diagnosed primarily in terms of symptoms (i.e., pain, tingling, numbness, sensory disturbances, muscle weakness), the anatomic distribution of symptoms (i.e., symptoms occurring in the same region on both sides of the body), and changes in anatomic sites affected over time (i.e., progression of symptoms in a "sock and glove pattern" from toes and fingertips moving proximally up limbs).
purpose: (Clinical Focus: The value set contains ICD10CM billing codes for distal symmetric polyneuropathy (DSP).),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify people diagnosed with distal symmetric polyneuropathy. This element may map to the "Diagnosis" Category of the Quality Data Model.),(Inclusion Criteria: ICD10CM billing codes for distal symmetric polyneuropathy (DSP).),(Exclusion Criteria: Excludes disorders involving system atrophies in which peripheral polyneuropathy is one of many components (e.g., multiple sclerosis).)
